column2: Mom_of_2_girlz, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: I have a 4 yr. old who has been perscribed this medication for the treatment of ringworm of the scalp.  She most likely picked the fungus up from our local public pool and we have been dealing with this since the beginng of July 2010. We are seeing very noticable changes on her scalp.  She is getting her hair back and it is staying in even after being brushed.(before the meds. her hair would come back and upon brushing would fall right back out).  We are also using a fungal shampoo, Keto 2%.  The only problem I have had with my daughter was getting her to take the medication, the flavor it comes in is a orange and has a bitter taste.  She would make her-self vomit after she was given the oral medication.  There were no other medications available to her so we had to get it down her somehow.  We put it in juices, ice cream, pudding.  You name it and she found it everytime.  I went to our local Walgreen's and they were able to change the taste by adding bubble gum flavoring to it.  It was the BEST $2.99 I ever spent.  She takes it now with no fuss what so ever.  We have had no side effects at all.  The medication MUST be taken with fatty foods this helps the body to absorb the medication.  Ringworm is easy to catch and hard to get rid of.  It is a long treatment, so stick with it.  As soon as you think it is gone and stop treatment it will come right back.  Check with your Doctor before you stop treatment.
